title: Drawing, The elevation of a tower-like structure for a firework at the feast of St. Rosalia in Palermo, 1780–1810
title_raw: The elevation of a tower-like structure for a firework at the feast of St. Rosalia in Palermo
medium: pencil with grey and black brush on paper
markings: Watermark of a name in an inscription tablet. A stripe is pasted on at the top.
inscribed: Caption, written with ink in the upper left corner: Machina de fuaco da incendiarci la/ferza sera in capti occasione ulla festa di/s. Rosalia in Palermo
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical composition of a tower-like structure. A dado is at the bottom with sprial-shaped candelabra and angels on pedestals sketched in pencil. The lower story of the tower shows columns and pilasters of Ionic order. A painting hangs on the central wall. Statues of saints stand in niches in the obliquelydispersed lateral walls. The upper story has a dado with an escutcheon on the front. Steps rise on the dado with statues standing at the corners of the lowest one. The story has pilasters of Corinthian order at the corners. An ovoidal painting is at the central wall. On top is a pedestal with two virtues and with a painted representation referring to the saint. A statue of the Virgin with the Child stands on a column on the pedestal. Many brackets carry candles.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, The elevation of a tower-like structure for a firework at the feast of St. Rosalia in Palermo, 1780–1810; Italy; pencil with grey and black brush on paper; H x W: 31.3 × 61.9 cm (12 5/16 × 24 3/8 in.); Museum purchase through gift of various donors; 1901-39-2684
